dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 5711 IH: Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Graves of Missouri (for himself, Mr. Larsen of Washington, and Mr. Smith of Missouri) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committees on Ways and Means, and Science, Space, and Technology, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to extend authorizations for the airport improvement program, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the funding and expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2023.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 102. Extension of expiring authorities; miscellaneous authorizations.
Sec. 104. Air navigation facilities and equipment.
Sec. 201. Expenditure authority from Airport and Airway Trust Fund.
Sec. 202. Extension of taxes funding Airport and Airway Trust Fund.

subsection.text: Section 48103(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (5) by striking the and at the end;
in paragraph (6) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
$842,076,502 for the period beginning on October 1, 2023, and ending on December 31, 2023.

subsection.text: Subject to limitations specified in advance in appropriation Acts, sums made available pursuant to the amendment made by subsection (a) may be obligated at any time through September 30, 2024, and shall remain available until expended.

For purposes of calculating funding apportionments and meeting other requirements under sections 47114, 47115, 47116, and 47117 of title 49, United States Code, for the period beginning on October 1, 2023, and ending on December 31, 2023, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall—

paragraph.text: first calculate such funding apportionments on an annualized basis as if the total amount available under section 48103 of such title for fiscal year 2024 was $3,350,000,000; and
then reduce by 75 percent—

subparagraph.text: all funding apportionment amounts calculated under paragraph (1); and
amounts made available pursuant to subsections (b) and (f)(2) of section 47117 of such title.

subsection.text: Section 47104(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended in the matter preceding paragraph (1) by striking September 30, 2023, and inserting December 31, 2023,.

subsection.header: Extension of special rule for apportionments
subsection.text: Section 47114(c)(1)(J) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking 2023 to and inserting 2023, and for the period beginning on October 1, 2023, and ending on December 31, 2023, to.

section.header: Extension of expiring authorities; miscellaneous authorizations

Section 44803(h) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking September 30, 2023 and inserting December 31, 2023.

clause.text: $140,401,803 for the period beginning on October 1, 2023, and ending on December 31, 2023.

subsection.header: Compatible land use planning and projects by State and local governments

subsection.text: Section 50905(c)(9) of title 51, United States Code, is amended by striking October 1, 2023 and inserting January 1, 2024.

Section 186(d) of the Vision 100—Century of Aviation Reauthorization Act (Public Law 108–176; 117 Stat. 2518) is amended by inserting and for the period beginning on October 1, 2023, and ending on December 31, 2023, after fiscal years 2018 through 2023.

subsection.text: Section 409(d) of the Vision 100—Century of Aviation Reauthorization Act (49 U.S.C. 41731 note) is amended by striking September 30, 2023 and inserting December 31, 2023.

subsection.header: Pilot program for redevelopment of airport properties
subsection.text: Section 822(k) of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 47141 note) is amended by striking September 30, 2023 and inserting December 31, 2023.

section.header: Expenditure authority from Airport and Airway Trust Fund

subsection.text: Section 9502(d)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A) by striking October 1, 2023 and inserting January 1, 2024; and
in subparagraph (A) by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting or the Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2023;.

subsection.text: Section 9502(e)(2) of such Code is amended by striking October 1, 2023 and inserting January 1, 2024.

section.header: Extension of taxes funding Airport and Airway Trust Fund
